On Thu, 10 Apr 2003, Walden Mathews wrote:
> But 'DELETE <url>' doesn't translate to "delete this
> URL". Is there even a mechanism for "deleting" URLs?
> I thought not.

It doesn't?  Once DELETE <URL> succeeds, <URL>
no longer designates the location of a resource.
Further use of <URL> should result in a 404 or 410
from the server.  If you want to use <URL> in some
other context, thats fine, but it is no longer a
URL, just a string that has URL syntax and any
other string would do in its place.

-Alex-
